newsitem.title: USA: NHL ICE HOCKEY-GRETZKY NAMED EASTERN CONFERENCE ALL-STAR STARTER.
newsitem.headline: NHL ICE HOCKEY-GRETZKY NAMED EASTERN CONFERENCE ALL-STAR STARTER.

text.p: Wayne Gretzky of the New York Rangers will make his first-ever start for the Eastern Conference in the 1997 NHL All-Star game.
Gretzky headed the list of six starters named to the Eastern Conference team for the January 18 game in San Jose, California in the final fan balloting released on Monday.
The veteran centre had been voted to all but one of nine Western Conference starting lineups since fan balloting began in 1986 and will be playing in his 16th All-Star game.

Gretzky will be flanked by wingers Jaromir Jagr of the Pittsburgh Penguins, named to a starting position for the fifth consecutive time, and Dino Ciccarelli of the Tampa Bay Lightning, who will make his first All-Star game start.
Gretzky's teammate, Brian Leetch, is one of the starting defencemen along with Ray Bourque of the Boston Bruins.
John Vanbiesbrouck of the Florida Panthers led all vote-getters with 334,919 and will make his first career All-Star start in goal.

Gretzky -- in his first season in the Eastern Conference after playing in Edmonton, Los Angeles and St. Louis -- led all centres with 196,603 votes. Rangers teammate Mark Messier was second in the voting at centre with 164,77 votes.

Jagr, who led all wingers with 302,212 votes, currently has 56 points, including a league-high 33 goals. Jagr and teammate Mario Lemieux share the NHL lead with 56 points, four more than Gretzky, who leads the NHL with 38 assists.
Ciccarelli, who has 33 goals and 56 assists, finished with 182,514 votes to earn the starting berth ahead of John LeClair of Philadelphia (169,262).

Bourque had 285,624 votes and was named to his 15th All-Star squad. He became the only player to have received an All-Star game starting berth in all 10 years of fan balloting. Leetch had 284,504 votes, ahead of Ed Jovanovski of Florida (250,075).
Leetch has nine goals and 31 assists and Bourque has two goals and 12 assists.
Vanbiesbrouck, who easily won the balloting at goal ahead of Martin Brodeur of New Jersey (167,805), is 12-6-6 with a 2.15 goals against average.
The Western Conference starters were released last week. The reserves for both teams will be announced later this week.
